bibdata.title: Incremental recap dump files are not uploaded to S3

comments.body:
This looks to be a performance & memory issue. On the alma staging machine (5 sidekiq threads), this is the data from `top`:

25 minutes:   99.3% cpu  73.7% memory
40 minutes:   99.3% cpu  90.0% memory

Best guess, the sidekiq jobs saturate the available memory. It's strange and annoying that the jobs are considered "complete" when the threads terminate.

`perf` wasn't that helpful

```
   5.60%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] 0x00000000000ae361
   5.11%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] 0x00000000000ae358
   3.52%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] 0x00000000000ae33f
   2.85%  util.rb:23     libc-2.27.so          [.] 0x00000000000bb4ea
   2.77%  util.rb:23     libc-2.27.so          [.] 0x00000000000bb4e6
   2.77%  util.rb:23     libc-2.27.so          [.] 0x00000000000bb4f2
   2.70%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] 0x00000000000b124d
   2.62%  util.rb:23     libc-2.27.so          [.] 0x00000000000bb4ee
   2.27%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] rb_wb_protected_newobj_of
   2.08%  util.rb:23     libc-2.27.so          [.] cfree
   1.55%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] 0x00000000000b1154
   1.52%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] 0x00000000000b2488
   1.47%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] 0x00000000000b1e14
   1.45%  util.rb:23     libruby-2.6.so.2.6.6  [.] 0x00000000000af172
   1.25%  util.rb:23     libc-2.27.so          [.] malloc
```
It's not that they're considered complete, it's that the OS terminates the thread to free memory and the job doesn't make it back. Sidekiq-pro fixes that.
"If a Sidekiq process crashes while processing a job, that job is lost." Yep. That's what's going on. Not sure if it's worth $950 / year.
This is done https://catalog-alma-qa.princeton.edu/catalog?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search_field=all_fields&q=id%3Adsp*.

dspace-development.title: Link to PRDS DataSpace help page from submission forms
Provide access to the HTTP REST API for Symplectic Elements

comments.body:
In order to advance this, a number of steps were required:

- Ensuring that the bindings for port 8091 were enabled for the TLS on the Microsoft Server environment from within the IIS configuration
- Ensuring that the user under which the application is running has the proper access control list privileges to bind to this port
- Ensuring that Elements provides access (at the application level) to the API endpoint for clients authenticated over the VPN

The second step for this is achieved with the following Powershell command (invoked with administrative privileges):

```psh
PS C:\windows\system32> netsh http add urlacl url=https://+:8091/elements-api/v4.9/ user=%USERDOMAIN%\%USERNAME%
```

HTTP `Basic` authentication is then offered in the response from the server for the API endpoint:

```bash
curl -v https://oaworkflow.princeton.edu:8091/elements-api/v4.9/
[...]
>
< HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
< Content-Length: 0
< Server: Microsoft-HTTPAPI/2.0
< WWW-Authenticate: Basic realm="Symplectic Elements at Organisation (API)"
< Date: Fri, 21 May 2021 14:14:52 GMT
<
* Connection #0 to host oaworkflow.princeton.edu left intact
* Closing connection 0
```

Please be aware that this does not integrate with Single Sign-On for the application.

Modifying the `API accounts` yields that users *can* successfully authenticate using `https://oaworkflow.princeton.edu:8091/elements-api/v4.9`. However, a 401 response is provided for requesting `https://oaworkflow.princeton.edu:8091/elements-api/v4.9/`. I have been trying to diagnose this using the IIS documentation, and I am proceeding now with the Symplectic Support platform.

Access to the API is now available for clients on the VPN with authorized users:

```bash
export ELEMENTS_SECRET=$(echo -n 'rest:$SECRET' | base64)
curl -H "Authorization: Basic $ELEMENTS_SECRET" https://oaworkflow.princeton.edu:8091/elements-api/v4.9/users
```

Thank you James, noticing the $SECRET and $ELEMENTS_SECRET there, Are these
credentials that you can make available to us, or should we configure them
in the admin ui?

figgy.title: Review Comment and additional settings in "edit scanned resource" did not hold save/submit when page was refreshed.

comments.body: are we not able to update/edit and save item records while image ingests are processing?
USUALLY it's fine, it looks like you just happened to hit a bad window. :(
That's good, though! Id rather it be a rare occurrence and just my bad timing. Ok. I will close the ticket and will reopen if it happens again (how many bad windows can i find, i wonder?!) Thanks.

TL;DR: We need to wait for one of these to break to get a thread backtrace to figure out if we have a thread leak.

https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/53391/faults/35108866/01F65P9QDDF1EEW4EEEB18WG9B is the error that's killing these. As soon as this happens that worker's dead and can no longer pick up jobs.

According to https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/issues/2862 this is likely because there's a thread leak in our code somewhere - something's spawning a thread and not getting rid of itself, we'll have to make sure that thread-spawner's not run in the Sidekiq process. Maybe Bunny? That'd be my guess.

We can find out by waiting until a worker dies, leaving it, and doing the following:

In one pane:

`sudo tail -f /var/log/syslog | grep sidekiq`

In another:

`ps aux | grep sidekiq` (get sidekiq Process ID)
Check the thread count:
`sudo ps HuH p sidekiq_pid | wc -l` <-- This should be pretty high if it's our problem.
`sudo kill -TTIN sidekiq_pid`

Then copy the backtrace of all the threads (dumped into syslog) into this issue so we can diagnose them. The TTIN signal will dump the backtrace, as per https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/wiki/Signals#ttin

The OTHER possibility is https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/33600.

Coverage remained the same at 96.753% when pulling **e0952c1e72d63c52618ff544e0de8ad7435456a5 on alma** into **a1aa8cab6891a13dd1d9b7de12a7c91791c85eec on main**.

ðŸ‘ðŸ» @carolyncole The plan we thought we would try was to have this alma branch here on orangelight to use for deploy to the alma / orangelight servers. In general we plan to continue submitting alma PRs to `main`. The catch is that to deploy we'll have to rebase this branch on main and then deploy this branch. If that becomes too onerous we can just switch to using the branch on orangelight, as well.
